doc.after: As of 2008, the deepest mine in the world is TauTona in Carletonville, South Africa at 3.9 kilometres (2.4Â mi),[69] replacing the neighboring Savuka Mine in the North West Province of South Africa at 3,774 metres (12,382Â ft).[70] East Rand Mine in Boksburg, South Africa briefly held the record at 3,585 metres (11,762Â ft), and the first mine declared the deepest in the world was also TauTona when it was at 3,581 metres (11,749Â ft).
